reviews.reviewTitle: SAMSUNG DOES NOT KNOW THEIR PRODUCTS
reviews.reviewText:
Most reviews said volume was too low So i searched the sound bar manual and the rear spkr kit manual and called Samsung Support.by phone and got an E mail that both told me that there was NO WAY TO CONTROL VOLUME on the rear spkrs. Samsung does not Know their products very well, as there is a way
Samsung needs to publish as I am sure many of these rear spkr kits have had poor reviews and likely returned
Here is the FIX: Press the 'sound control' button on the soundbar remote. to get to rear speaker on/off, then 1 more time to get to rear speaker volume (-6 to +6).using up/ down arrows
Easy. A further note, Using clear voice really makes a difference as the rear spkrs in some cases "muddy" the voices
A great test is the James Bond opening in Specter the helicopter "flys" Behind you! Watch on Amazon Prime

reviews.reviewTitle: Hard to Setup but once you figure it out they are quality
reviews.reviewDate: The manufacturer commented on the review below
reviews.reviewText:
The base is wireless, the speakers are not. But that was fine for my install since I put my speakers behind my couch where you couldn't see the wires to each speaker.

The manual is absolutely terrible. Here are the keys to get these speakers working thanks to lots of google searches.

1) Do not insert the speaker wire cables all the way in. The metal part must be touching the clamp. I found this out the hard way. Very frustrating that they don't mention this in the manual.

2) Turn off the Samsung soundbar then press the up arrow button for 5 second for it to go into LINK mode. I have the Samsung HW-N550 sound bar but I read others need with different Samsung bars need to press and hold the mute button. The manual says press up on the volume button which didn't work for me. Once you see the LINK mode on the LED display the unit should pair with the wireless rear speakers.

3) Once paired you will most likely find the volume is too low. To adjust it up click on the SOUND SETTINGS button which on my remote looks like a cog. Press it until REAR SPEAKERS displays, then WAIT! After showing you that it will say REAR SPEAKER VOLUME .. WAIT! then a number will show up (usually zero) the use the UP arrow to increase to your desired volume (0-6). I found 4 was optimal since you don't want the rear speaker volume to over power the main system.

I give the HW-N550 sound bar five stars and these rear speakers four. I think they could be better but for the money it's totally worth the upgrade for true surround experience.

reviews.reviewDate: The manufacturer commented on the review below
reviews.reviewText:
These have improved my soundbar sound quality and loudness x3! These add a real surround sound.

HERES MY ADVICE:
1. Turn the rear speaker volume up to +4(+5/6 just overpower the sound bar. These are meant to add sound, not be the main source of the sound.)
2. Turn your tv audio output settings to "Surround" and "DTS/Neo 2:5" (Dolby Digital can be a little quieter on sound effects)
3. Turn surround on soundbar, and put it in standard audio mode.
4. Use optical, not HDMI. For some reason the optical sound output is just louder than HDMI on Samsung soundbars.
5. Buy some speaker stands that hide the wires through the stand tubing. It will look truly wireless.

I like these speakers and they were specifically bought for use with my Samsung Soundbar system. The speakers a very small and can be put on stands or mounted on the wall. Best if placed behind where you sit to get the full effect of movie or sports sounds. I gave the four stars mainly because the volume that comes out off the speakers is not quite load enough but for the price they fit my needs just as the soundbar does. New 4K TV, soundbar, 4K Blue-ray Player, and these speakers make for a perfect movie night for the family. Samsung is very good quality stuff.

reviews.reviewTitle: great eventually once you know all the ins and outs
reviews.reviewText:
great to pair with my Samsung sound bar. not to others that when you hear wireless that means that you do not have to have the whole unit connected to the other surround sound or mixer/soundbar as it should pair through your Samsung TV. the speaker do require wires from it to the main unit. For me, i have wires in my walls going to back off living room so i just had to slide in red and black in to the back of them. Then i had to run the wires from my back plate behind TV to the main unit. ** note that the wires are barely uncovered and the actual wires have to touch metal or contact otherwise you will not get sound.
adjusting volume on the rear speakers is also very hard. If you have the soundbar in BT mode you will be able to cycle through treble, bass, etc to rear-speaker but then when you try and adjust volume it will just turn speaker of or back on. It wasn't until i hooked up my sound bar to the TV via optical cable that i was able to cycle through the rear speaker using sounbar remote and adjust the rear speakers to +6. not with these systems and cable boxes. cable boxes have there own volume control and you have to turn that all the way up and then control teh sound through the soundbar as i figured out. sound now eventually is great!

reviews.reviewTitle: I mounted this to my wall behind my couch and it sounds just as great as my other samsung HTIB system in the other ...
reviews.reviewText:
I purchased this rear speaker module to go along with my new Samsung soundbar https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B06XP19HRW/ref=oh_aui_detailpage_o01_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1

This module makes your soundbar a true surround system similar to the home theater in a box systems. I mounted this to my wall behind my couch and it sounds just as great as my other samsung HTIB system in the other room (which also uses a wireless rear module.)

Pros:
- Easy to set up, just follow the instructions to link to the samsung system, very easy.
- Low profile, easy to hide behind a couch or other furniture to make it out of sight.
- Makes your new samsung soundbar a true 5.1 system.

Cons:
- Yes the speakers themselves are wired, at this price point you are not going to find truly wireless speakers that are worth anything

reviews.reviewTitle: Great addition to the HW-N850 soundbar
reviews.reviewText: I just purchased this as an addition to my new HW-N850 which is a 5.1.2 Atmos capable system. As good as my soundbar is, it still lacks and immersed experience when watching. The HW-N950 has surround speakers and is a 7.1.4 system but is roughly $400 more. Thus comes in the SW-9000S. And since this model is on sale almost everywhere averaging $100 (lower in Amazon), the SW-9000S is a no-brainer for my soundbar. Setup is a breeze and there's no need to install the included receiver for N series soundbars. Volume is a bit tinny though and it's surprising that volume for this is at a max once paired with the soundbar. And though this speaker set does not convert my soundbar into a 7.1.4 system, a 7.1.2 system makes me a happy camper.

reviews.reviewTitle: OK sound (except for subwoofer) but too expensive for limited flexibility
reviews.reviewDate: The manufacturer commented on the review below
reviews.reviewText:
I purchased the whole set including the 750 Soundbar, 700 subwoofer, and wireless rear SWA-9000S/ZA) surrounds as a set.

The Soundbar and rears came first, so I set them up and used for two days without the sub.

Soundbar is a vast improvement over cheap small speakers in even the newest nicest new TVs. The only shortcoming is there is no left-right volume balance control. Due to my bedroom setup my TV is in a corner, so there is no “room filling sound”. It just all comes from the corner of the room under my TV. Of the eleven speakers, one is right firing and the other left. With all their “modes” (which don’t seem to vary much), you’d think you could control left right balance. You can’t. With that being said, sound quality and volume were superb. Adjusting the “upward firing speakers” did give some nice depth of feel to the sound.

Rear surrounds: The only control you have is volume. Again, No left/right balance. For my placement of speakers that meant all I heard was the right speaker. No way to turn down the right and turn up the left. Horrible shortcoming. Sound quality was good (except for not hearing my left channel at all due to room placement.

Received s700 subwoofer two days later and hooked up. Even on value 6 (max) and after playing for hours with various settings/modes I honestly could not tell any difference with sub on at full volume or unplugged. It produced negligible volume and did not add one bit to the sound stage or any deep base enhancements at all. It produces virtually no effect. Add to that, there are zero controls (except the useless volume). No cross-over or frequency settings, nothing. The Soundbar decides what it gets and to me totally useless. Certainly not worth over $400.

After hours researching on-line, and hours on Samsung’s phone tech support (very nice but not helpful) there were simply no solutions.

If you have a proper TV room or bedroom, with the TV in the middle of the wall, and your couch or bed directly opposed, the Soundbar and rear surrounds might be a good option. If you need flexibility and control of sounds this is not a good option. And unless my subwoofer was defective it little more than a joke.

I am returning all. Even though I ordered as the set on Amazon, they billed each item separately, and as I tried to return the Subwoofer was informed this item was non-returnable. Thankfully a very nice Amazon rep I reached on the phone waived that.

I’ve had some very nice Samsung products and like the brand and customer service. I guess I was expecting too much from the “Sound Bar” setup. I’ll be going back to ordering separates (Probably Denon-based) that I know I can customize to achieve the true surround sound I need.

Great compliment to the system. I located them on both sides of the couch and they help me hear the conversations better without turning it up loud. I did not find a way to control the volume separately to these speakers other than changing the sound mode in the main system. "Music" mode seems to give me the most sound through the speakers. I am glad I purchased them.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works great! Paired up to the Samsung HW-M550 sound bar
reviews.reviewText: Works great! Paired up to the Samsung HW-M550 sound bar. At first it was not pairing up with the sound bar, turned out the sound bar was the issue so i returned the sound bar to BestBuy and with the new sound bar everything works great and sounds great 👍🏾

reviews.reviewTitle: You Neeed to Install Correctly for Maximum Sound
reviews.reviewDate: The manufacturer commented on the review below
reviews.reviewText:
These work great, and contrary to most reviews they can get EXTREMELY LOUD if installed correctly.
Step one is making sure they are even compatible with your soundbar.

The next steps are the biggest pain. You need to make sure your TV is set up correctly in its advanced audio settings and that the source is too (Cable box, Xbox, etc...). Your source needs to be set to Bitstream audio, then set to either Dolby Digital or DTS. THEN your TV's audio needs to be set to Bitstream then also Dolby Digital or DTS.

Each time you switch between a Cable box or Xbox, your TV audio settings will revert back to non surround sound. You will need to switch it back to Dolby Digital or DTS.

Doing all of the above will make the rear speakers work exactly as intended, and loud.

If you don't change the settings the rear speakers will be so quiet that it barely produces noise OR will act as nothing more than extra speakers for audio and will not produce surround sound.

reviews.reviewTitle: When hooking up the speakers do not insert the shielding only insert the bare wire.
reviews.reviewText: I have the Samsung sound bar HW-N650 I purchased the Samsung SWA-8500S speaker system as an add on. Wow was I surprised. The hook up was so easy. The system paired up without any problems. I gave 4 stars only because the sound out of the speakers could be a we bit louder as they only max out at 6. Other than that this system is a must and will complete your setup. Over all watching a movie they do a very good job. When it comes to listening to music they will blow your mind. For the price you can't go wrong. I know there a lot of reviews on this but if you do your home work and take your time when hooking this system up I think you might be pleased. ( Just remember when inserting the wires into the speakers pay attention the positive and negative. Positive is marked in red, negative is marked in black. Only insert the bare wire not the shielding. If you insert the wire to deep in the speaker socket it catches the shielding and if this happens then you are not making contact and there will be no sound coming out of the speaker) Great product, Great price, Worth the purchase.

reviews.reviewTitle: Low volume??? Check that wires are STRIPPED!
reviews.reviewText: If your volume is low or you are not hearing anything check the wires to make sure they are fully stripped and metal is exposed. Mine were not, and it wasn’t apparent until I restripped the ends. I bet most, of not all the reviews with low volume have this defect from the factory. Wires seem ready to plug and play but they are not. Also, turn up volume of rears on soundbat.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very Happy I purchased the SWA-8500S Wireless Rear Speakers Kit.
reviews.reviewText:
The kit complements the HW-MM55/ZA soundbar I also own. I knew that the kit was not completely wireless. The receiver module is wireless but you have to attach the two surround speakers using speaker wire that is provided. The speaker wires and receiver inputs are clearly marked.

The receiver module is paired to the soundbar. The paring process is as follows: The receiver module is plugged in, and the LINK LED indicator will blink. The soundbar should be turned off. Then, the instructions say to press the VOL button on the remote control to the sound bar for about 5 or 6 seconds until the "ID SET" message appears on the soundbar. This does not work. The button that should be pressed is the Mute button. Once the right button is pushed, the LINK LED button becomes a solid blue. At this point, the receive module is paired with the soundbar.

At first, I thought the speakers were not functioning. The issue is connecting the speaker wire to the speaker. If you push the wire in too far, it doesn't make the necessary contact. Pairing the speakers to the sound bar was difficult because the instructions given in the user manual are not correct. Once paired, the rear speakers are controlled using the remote control for the sound bar.

The soundbar must be set to Surround Sound using the SOUND MODE button. The Sound Control button adjusts the TREBLE, BASS, AUTO SYNC, REAR SPEAKERS ON, and REAR LEVEL. Changes are made using the UP and DOWN buttons. I turned the REAR LEVEL to max. The sound quality is awesome! Takes the sounds of Movies, Music & Games to whole other level with quality surround sound.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good sound for sound bar speakers
reviews.reviewText:
Physical set-up very easy, pairing was easy, keep in mind that rear surround speakers are for accents, sound movement, and vary in volume depending on the show. The speakers are small, 3" X 5", I failed to look at the size before purchasing and was surprised at how small they were. The speaker wire is very thin attesting to the low voltage. All appropriate and typical for a sound bar system. We have our set-up in our basement living room and it's totally adequate for the space. The speaker quality and sound is good for what they're intended for. It's important to remember this type of set-up is not a high-powered, high-end system. We choose not to try and boost the volume as others have done, because they're not meant to act like the front speakers and are pre-set and balanced. Overall we're happy with the purchase but if you want powerful sound, don't even start with a sound bar, get a receiver and buy substantial front, center and rear speakers, plus the woofer. You'll pay about $1500+. So for the money, a sound bar, woofer, and these rear speakers are MUCH better than the TV speaker, and do better in a smaller space like a bedroom or small living room. If your expectations are appropriate for a sound bar system, you'll love them. If you're expecting a booming system that blows you away, you'll be very disappointed, because that's not what these speakers are intended for.

UPDATE: "HOW TO": SWA8500s(ZA) "ZA" means made in America, same system, ignore it unless you live outside the US. "ZC" stands for made in Canada. Despite people saying the Samsung R60C (Costco) sound bar/woofer is not compatible with the SWA8500s, IT IS! We discovered "rear speaker" settings on our Samsung R60C (Costco) display box by repeatedly pressing the settings button (cogwheel), which is not made clear in the manual. Maxed out the rear speakers (+6), maxed out the bass (+6), maxed out the woofer (+6) and turned up the treble. Again, "changing" the settings from factory pre-sets (0) are done by pressing the top and bottom of the wheel for bass, treble and rear speakers, but adjusting the sound bar volume is done by toggling the volume switch up and down, and adjusting the woofer with the woofer toggle. So you use 3 different buttons for these adjustments. Very poor information from Samsung, and is probably the reason so many of these units are returned and the ratings are fairly poor. It's not obvious how to adjust these speakers, or the sound bar in general. Huge difference with new adjustments, much happier with the sound. Changed out the HDMI with the Optical cable which some said was an improvement, but it's' not. Went back to the HDMI because it carries more sound formats (especially with a 4K TV/DVD player) and is preferred over the optic cable if you have HDMI capabilities. Hang in there with the adjustments before you send it back, it will be worth it!

Quality overall for the price - 5 stars! I did not feel the need to ding these for terrible instructions or for the fact that they are not truly wireless. For those looking for true wireless, these are not them.

After opening and discovering there are wires after all, my plans changed form mounting on the wall near the ceiling to sitting them on the end tables with the wires and the bluetooth receiver box under the couch. It won't make my wife happy, but it's good enough for now.

Coming back and reading many reviews (thank you to all those with the facts on how to operate these), these speakers are simply incredible. Compared to my bulky amplifier, the two 80 pound towers, 40 pound subwoofer and two 10 pound satellite speakers, not to mention the myriad of wires, well, there's simply no comparison! The cost is 1/4 that of the old traditional sound system and it opened up our living room to, well, more "living room" lol.

Bottom line, these worked out for me both for budget and definitely for quality.

The speakers work great. They look great. They are easy to set up. The only thing that I noticed is that it is not completely plug n play. I had to look up how to connect the speakers wirelessly to my system. And the instructions did not come with the speakers, so I had to find the instructions online. Once the speakers were connected. I have had nothing but a great experience with them. I bought them to work with my Samsung HW-M450/ZA 2.1 Channel Soundbar and they work perfectly.

reviews.reviewDate: The manufacturer commented on the review below
reviews.reviewText: First, the sound is very faint. Certainly not worth the cost and extra clutter if you can barely hear the speakers. Second, the unit is only partially wireless. You need to plug in the amplifier/transmitter to a wall socket for power, but it doesn't need to be connected to the soundbar - so that is wireless. However, the two speakers need to be connected to the amplifier, so you're still running wires. I have a Samsung TV and a Samsung Soundbar, but I'll wait to buy additional speakers once Samsung can make remote, wireless speakers to match the sound quality of its Soundbars.

The Samsung 8500S 2.0 Wireless Speaker System is a great addition to my Samsung N450 Soundbar and Samsung 55" 4K UHD Smart TV. It enhances my overall viewing and listening pleasure. The pairing of the 8500S was a little challenging at first because the instructions are not very clear, but I figured it out and haven't had any problems since. Basically just reset your soundbar before connecting with this system and pairing should be easily achieved. The surround sound is great and more prevalent on certain movies, shows and sporting events. I have my 8500S rear speakers (Soundbar description) sound level set on +3 and after some adjustments, which takes time, makes this entire Samsung set up enjoyable.
Recommend

reviews.reviewDate: The manufacturer commented on the review below
reviews.reviewText:
Here's the deal: it's no help to comment on speaker volume as good/bad without noting geometry of speaker layout. These are good, inexpensive speakers with few options to adjust. If you want value and simple these speakers may be great for you - BUT you must consider your speaker geometry.

Yes, there are Treble and Bass controls but driven by the sound bar for all attached speakers. Yes, there is a 0-6 rear satellite volume adjustment but this is not enough for many situations.

Simply put, at Rear Speaker Volume +6, the satellite speaker output almost equals the main bar. Anything less and the main bar is stronger than the satellites. Whether this is a problem for you depends on distance between the speakers AND which way they are facing relative to listeners. Example: If both main and satellites are pointed directly at you, and are the same distance from you, at Vol +6, you will hear both about equally. If you are further from one, or if it is pointed away, you will get an imbalance.

In short: these work great for simple layouts where the satellites are closer to listeners than the sound bar. But they ARE NOT room filling speakers (particularly large rooms). Worse, they lack the independent controls to adjust for any imbalance situations.

reviews.reviewTitle: * They sound amazing. Volume can be adjusted from the cellphone app ...
reviews.reviewDate: The manufacturer commented on the review below
reviews.reviewText:
To sum up what many reviews say (I have them connected to a Samsung Soundbar HW-650):
* They sound amazing. Volume can be adjusted from the cellphone app Samsung Multiroom
* It's a painful process to make them work. At the begining they joined to the soundbar in a minute, but then they got disconnected and took me 2 hours to join them again.
* What I did to make it work? Tried a bunch of things, but at the end what it worked was:
1) Disconnect all the devices from the soundbar (including the TV)
2) Try to join them using the cellphone app.
3) If it doesn't work, reset the soundbar to factory default, reset the speakers to factory default (using the little hole at the back, follow manual's instructions) and try to join them again
4) Connect the rest of the devices to the soundbar (including the TV)
Hope it helps.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great Addition to my HW-MS650 Sound+ Premium Soundbar
reviews.reviewText: I picked up HW-MS650 Soundbar (Bestbuy) and started to add the sub (Bestbuy) & rear speakers (Amazon) as they went on sale. Amazingly the price on Amazon dropped to $67.00 and since that's the lowest I have ever seen them I pulled the trigger. Even at regular price these speakers complement the surround sound and make a big difference. The Dolby effect is awesome and even the sub which is not the overpowering kind sounds great. Since I got all at a decent sale price this setup is worth it and I am very happy with it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Sweet unit when combined with rear satellite speakers.
reviews.reviewText: Great sound and works beautifully with my new Samsung Qled tv. Good voice reproduction and when paired with the optional rear surround speakers, you would think it is a 5.1 surround sound home theater system that cost much much more. Very happy with it. Replaced a Vizio unit that was constantly changing from my CEC digital in ARC setting to tv speaker all on its own. This unit keeps whatever settings I select and has better front indicators that tell you what level of volume setting you are selecting as you turn up or down the volume. The Vizio only had small light bar indicators that were not very helpful. So glad I replaced the Vizio with this Samsung soundbar and satellite speakers. Bluetooth pairing was automatic with this unit, unlike the Vizio which required me to press a button on the subwoofer to get the rear speakers to sync up with the soundbar, something you have to keep doing if the unit loses power. Worth the money, though it isn't an inexpensive purchase. Sound is excellent and woofer creates some excellent base responses when watching movies. I'm a happy camper!

reviews.reviewTitle: not the best in terms of performance but they do add some ...
reviews.reviewDate: The manufacturer commented on the review below
reviews.reviewText:
Ehhh...they're ok. I brought these to compliment my 750 soundbar... not the best in terms of performance but they do add some rear surrrond sound, albeit at a low volume, to my setup ( my advice with wall mounting is mount them low )
. My only gripe is that the volume and effect options for these are limited. For 120 bucks they are worth it though, especially if your not looking to run a full 5.1 system with a receiver.

reviews.reviewTitle: Impressive for a first timer like me having surround sound
reviews.reviewText: I'm not an audiophile, but upgrading my Samsung MS650 Soundbar with these Surround Sound speakers has been a great idea. In the past I only had a soundbar and a subwoofer, so adding these speakers definitely has added to the experience. My girlfriend even was impressed with the improved sound and I didn't tell her ahead of time that I was adding them. I also managed to get them on sale for only $80 so they've definitely been worth the investment. There's definitely a mixed experience depending on what I'm watching with some shows taking advantage of them much better than others, but Jurassic Park and outdoor movies have a noticeable surround sound feel.

edit, about a week into having them, they are still awesome. my wife who was on the fence about the purchase and really just 'let me' get them, agrees they are great. and wants them on the other tv as well. very important to setup correctly, go into the soundbar settings and output surround, ( I found little differences with game, movie etc..) use surround. then settings on the tv, output 5.1 or PCM, then into your cable box settings and set audio to advanced 5.1 output. (Xfinity X1 boxes the simple mode outputs stero.) Do these things and the beauty of surround sound is yours.

love em, syncing was easy but only because of another review that explained NOT to use the volume key per the manual but rather the arrow up key. with that information in hand. 10 minutes tops. the hardest part was deciding where to put them. adjust the sound using the soundbars remote turn up rear speakers to desired setting, put the bar into 'surround mode" and in my case turn up audio which I think is the center channel since I feel like it got clearer when I did.

I purchased these to go with the $100 Samsung sound bar/sub [HW-MM36] that I bought a couple months ago. I didn't realize there were add-on speakers, but I'm glad I found these. They really are an amazing touch to this system when you consider price. Everyone says that they don't sound like Bose, and they are correct. However, if you are looking at these speakers, chances are you don't have $2500 to spend on the bottom model of a high end system anyway. They sound awesome for their price and you would be mistaken not to add these to your system. If you are on a budget and want to get surround sound, these are your speakers. Also, if you are watching movies off of your computer, try using Potplayer and playing around with the audio settings in the App. It acts as a pre-amplifier/equalizer and increases the sound quality/level by at least 10. Installation was simple and took less than 5 minutes.
Things you should know:
There are a couple things you should know first. These speakers only work with select Samsung sound bars, so make sure your system is compatible.
The speakers are not truly wireless. They utilize a wireless device back to the sound bar, but they use wires from the wireless device to the rear speakers. Which is fine by me in my setup, most of us are just trying to get rid of the run from the sound bar to the rear speakers anyway.
The speakers are small, don't be alarmed, I think you will be happy with the sound.
I am very happy with this purchase and have already told my friends about this system.

reviews.reviewTitle: Sounds just as good as the soundbar
reviews.reviewText:
Good speakers for the price. The convenience of 'wireless' surround speakers is wonderful ("surround" is in quotations because some people get confused -- only the base station which the actual speakers connect to via wires, is wireless). I had some difficulty setting them up as I was convinced that all they were doing was replicating the left/right channels instead of creating true surround sound. A couple of tweaks in my Xbox's settings proved that I was just excluding a certain setting (exactly which setting it is, I couldn't say for sure. I had to tweak it quite a bit.)
Good speakers; would recommend.

These work better then expected, the people leaving neg reviews are probably trying to pair them with non compatible sound bars.

and yes you can adjust the volume of these speakers once paired, hit the setup or sprocket button on remote until you get to rear speaker level.

I forget i have these and then i get spooked or hear things and it sounds like people talking behind me lol.

I use the movie or cinema sound setting for tv and i also select the cinema sound setting on my tv since im using arc with hwm550.

reviews.reviewTitle: Awesome if You Are Planning to Use With Compatible Components
reviews.reviewText:
I paired these with a compatible Samsung sound bar very easily. I guess you could use the speakers with any type of home audio system, but if you don't have a sound bar (Samsung or not), this is not the surround speaker set you should be considering. If you do have a compatible Samsung sound bar, and that sound bar is connected to a compatible Samsung 4K flat screen TV, you'll probably be very happy with this set up.

I need to say something to the entire home audio industry first, though. It's about damned time I didn't need to take 6 hours out of my day to run and obfuscate all the speaker wires needed for each speaker. The next innovation needs to be quicker.

So, I had my Samsung sound bar and it's included wireless sub already hooked up to my Samsung TV. Consequently I spent some time being confused by the instructions included with these speakers. I highly recommend that instead of repeating my mistake, go directly to the sound bar's manual for pairing instructions. If it's compatible with these speakers, it will have a section on it. Apparently for a quick little giggle, Samsung made a funny and made the pairing process just a little different and unique for every different sound bar you can use. Thanks Samsung.

Nevermind reading the listing to determine the dimensions of something you want, these are WAYYYY smaller than the picture makes then look. Imagine a rectangle version of the older Bose cubes from the 90's. This wasn't a buzzkill for me, just unexpected, like when an 85 year old farts and wasn't expecting it.

Like I said, setup was a breeze, I spent the most time looking for two screws to use (each takes 1). I am OCD about things I attach to the wall from the standpoint of choosing not to hang something if a stud is not a available to anchor the screw into. That said, these are so light, you'd hand no problem hanging out of a wood screw which is just screwed into drywall.

They sound pretty good, but these are satellite surround sound speakers, so when they emit a sound, it's usually very obscure, and if you don't the time and configure your audio like Jesus would, it would blend seamlessly into the what's playing on the front speakers.

I'm a Samsung loyalist, but only to a certain point. Their products will usually recieve deference from me, but sometimes Allende brand has something they don't.

reviews.reviewDate: The manufacturer commented on the review below
reviews.reviewText:
UPDATE 2: With the new soundbar, the speakers work and do 5.1! There's been some crackling occassionally that I'm hoping I can solve but otherwise they work as 5.1. Really wish they'd note in the "compatible soundbars" section which do 2.1 and 5.1.

UPDATE: After doing extensive digging, my samsung soundbar HW360 doesn't decode 5.1, meaning the issue is my fault. I have ordered the HW550 soundbar that is advertised as decoding 5.1 and will update my review of these rear speakers when they arrive. Should really be a warning on these that connecting to some soudbars won't give you true 5.1.

I bought these in hopes that they would put out rear Left and Right channels in order to create a true surround effect. I was noticing I was getting full Left and Right on the speakers and so I called Samsung Support and they confirmed that there is no way to set them to do rear channel therefore you're not getting a full 5.1 experience. Seems like this could easily be implemented in a software update to push the rear channels to the speakers. They are nice speakers and do sound good so I still gave them 2 stars. Just disappointed they aren't giving me the full surround experience I was expecting to get.

reviews.reviewTitle: Hit or miss, depending on the [SAMSUNG] soundbar you link them to.
reviews.reviewText:
I tried these with the HW-Q60R soundbar. They worked well.

Had to upgrade to the HW-Q70R soundbar, because the Q60R did not support uncompressed 5.1 PCM audio, and the Nintendo Switch and my PC only output 5.1 PCM; they don't output 5.1 Dolby Digital or DTS. These rear speakers are terrible with the Q70R. The sound is VERY quiet. Even turning the rear speakers volume up to the maximum volume, +6, results in a very quiet sound from the rear speakers. Samsung has acknowledged this issue in multiple Samsung forums, and they haven't fixed the issue in years. The volume was perfectly fine when synced with the Q60R soundbar, and I didn't even need to turn up the rear speaker volume with it, but it's really low with the Q70R.

Additionally, there is a low, but very noticeable to me, hissing sound coming from the rear speakers that WAS NOT present when connected to the Q60R soundbar.

I'm giving the sound quality 5-stars, because I've listened to them when they work properly, but the incompatibility (there's no other word for this) with SOME soundbars - SAMSUNG soundbars for crying out loud! - makes me give them an overall rating of 1-star. This is an easy fix that could be solved with a firmware update, and Samsung has not done it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Hard a hard time pairing to sound bar, close ...
reviews.reviewText: Hard a hard time pairing to sound bar, close to returning but got it going. Okay for sound but voices are not as loud as i had hoped

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice add on to sound bar with subwoffer, but install add on can be tricky - incomplete instructions
reviews.reviewText: Once got connected works well, some challenges trying to have it pair with the TV when you already have a Samsung sound bar that was paired. No instruction related to that aspect. In trial and error, what I ended up doing was unplugging the subwoofer power, then I could get the speakers to pair. When I plugged back in the Subwoofer, everything worked. Also to get the the settings to adjust the volume was hit and miss, finally got to it while not noted in the instructions. In doing so initially had unlinked the function where all the TV remotes would turn on and adjust the volume of the Sound Bar and speakers, so you do not need to use the soundbar remote. Got it back again, just annoying having to keep trying the sequence of actions with the buttons and some of the time outs. Very happy with performance and ability to fine tune settings once got the hang of it.

I own the 11 Speaker Samsung Sound bar Plus. I have the subwoofer and now these speakers.

I have it set up in my living room in a condo. The room is configured in a 3 sided wall shape. It's trapezoid like. It makes for perfect sound bouncing and placement of speakers. Essentially the subwoofer at 0 level produces loud thunderous bangs and shakes for movies and smooth bass for music.

The addition of these speakers provide different sounds for different viewings. Some movies give background noises behind you while some give speech towards the back of you.

All in all. When I watch certain movies or play games I can sometimes here background noises and sometimes think someone is at the door or behind me. You will feel haunted if by yourself because of the magnitude of sounds.

Coming over from a 5.1 surround system I was worried that I would be missing something. Tried just the soundbar and sub and it definitely lacked so I oredered these. They paired right up with my Costco HW-R60C no trouble at all. I was also worried about the extra clutter and getting power to the wireless module, but I just put it on top of the sub in the spot where my old 5.1 receiver was and used the existing wires I had installed for that system to go from the module to my speakers. Nice and clean looking. Note, if you plan on just using your old maybe bigger rear channel speakers as I considered with this module, I wouldn't suggest it. These speakers are an oddball 3Ω. These filled in the sound feild nicely and passed the Steely Dan test.
Update: I have found one issue. The sounbar always defaults to the digital input or TV ARC. This is a problem if you run your STB into the sounbar first and then out to the ARC port on your TV, as you will need to use the soundbar remote to switch back to the HDMI input. You can't just use one remote. If you run all your inputs to the TV first its not a problem, but you may lose 5.1 encoding.

Paired with: Samsung HW-M550 Soundbar

Very easy and straight forward to setup.. literally 30 seconds and it synced right up.

Sound isn't mind blowing but in the end it's just your surrounds but definitely adds a lot to my Soundbar. Would highly recommend anyone who owns the soundbar to add this to it. You won't regret it.

Be sure to verify it is compatible with your soundbar.

Some are surprised when they find out wires to the speakers route back to the "base". The only thing this is doing is keeping you from having to run speaker wire from the front of your room to the back.

reviews.reviewDate: The manufacturer commented on the review below
reviews.reviewText: this is the second one of these I have ordered and the second one I am sending back. Neither of them paired with my sound bar and Samsung "help" was non-existent. I have decided with Samsung products, if it doesn't work the first time, it will never work.

reviews.reviewTitle: not a good match with HW-Q70R
reviews.reviewDate: The manufacturer commented on the review below
reviews.reviewText: These do not have good output.. may work well if you have them directly behind your head but if you have them on the wall they do not have enough gain. I had to put them +6 and turn down the center / LR channels -6 to get a decent mix. Also, when in ATOMS mode they are pretty much useless which is very counter intuitive. possibly because atmos setups are supposed to have full range speakers all around you. either way it's just no enough signal to hear at any point of the cinima.

reviews.reviewDate: The manufacturer commented on the review below
reviews.reviewText:
Once you figure out how to install these and find proper instructions (by searching the internet not from the enclosed instructions, I recommend YouTube) they are super easy to set up.

These tiny speakers not much larger than a large coffee mug sit just above my head in my bed. I can barely hear them. I am always glad when I do, but it is rare. Really, don't bother. I went to a different sound system. Didn't return them, kept hoping they would get better and the issue was something other than tiny speakers. But tiny speakers give a tiny sound. Forget about spending money and time on these.

I had recently purchased the Samsung HW Q70R Soundbar and wanted the audio coming from my television to be a bit more immersive. These speakers do the trick, they make quite a bit of difference for the better.

Nice addition to my Samsung HW-M430 soundbar. Wireless speakers connected automatically with the soundbar. Soundbar controls rear volume. Rear volume control is not explained in the instructions, so you have to play with the soundbar settings. Only short fall is no left/right balance control.

reviews.reviewDate: The manufacturer commented on the review below
reviews.reviewText: I'm honestly disappointed in this item. After reading other reviews, I was skeptical of the poor performance, and purchased this anyway. It works, but genuinely, for me, it does nothing to improve the sound bar for movies and TV. The volume coming out of these is barely audible, despite the rear auxiliary volume on the sound bar turned all the way up. And I can only hear it if the speakers are within a couple of feet of my ear. Not what I was expecting at all. They seem to work better for Bluetooth streaming music than movies. Expected something better I guess.

reviews.reviewTitle: Absolutely Essential Add On 2D v. 3D Sound
reviews.reviewText: Essential addition to Samsung MS 650 3.1 channel soundbar. Creates true 5.1 channel surround sound. Crystal clear sound that goes from 2D front wall sound to 3D full room sound with these wireless surround speakers. Did take me several tries to get the system paired and working. But despite the initial difficulties this system is a must have for compatible Samsung soundbars.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great speakers and even this lil’ old 75 year old granny got them to work
reviews.reviewText: Wired it up and turned it on and after a few tweaks had great surround sound. Have one speaker near me and keep looking for where the sounds of doors, phones, and dogs barking are coming from...the sound is so real.

reviews.reviewTitle: Has an easy mistake you can mistake when setting up. Wish they were louder.
reviews.reviewText:
Was fairly easy to setup. Instructions lacked specifically when it came to inserting the wires into the speakers, which you have to make sure you only insert the exposed end of the wire and nothing more, otherwise the metal connection clamps will come down on the wire's jacket and the speakers will not produce sound.

The only thing that would make a future version of this product superior is more powerful speakers, but these are adequate for my setup after turning them up to max, and I do like that future versions of these may be backwards compatible with my current Samsung soundbar, so I may be able to get an improved version in the future. Still, I know from listening closely to 5.1 audio that it can vary in volume, and sometimes whatever you are listening to just had either a bad sound engineer or someone else along the way mucked the audio up.

Following products were bought with these to accompany it.

Speaker Stands (Make sure you get a stand with keyhole support.): Mounting Dream MD5401 Height Adjustable Speaker Stands Mounts, Two in One Floor Stands, Heavy Duty Base and ExtendableTube with 11 LBS Capacity Per Stand, 35.5-48" Height Adjustment

Soundbar: Samsung HW-M550 3.1 Channel 340 Watt Wireless Audio Soundbar (2017 Model)

HDMI Switch (Didn't want to take the chance of losing anything over Optical Audio and needed this due to four devices and only three inputs on TV.): Zettaguard 4K x 2K 4 Port 4 x 1 HDMI Switch with PIP and IR Wireless Remote Control, HDMI Switcher Hub Port Switches (ZW410)

reviews.reviewTitle: They are small and add a nice rear dimension of sound
reviews.reviewText: Got these as an addition to my Samsung sound bar I got at Costco. They are small and add a nice rear dimension of sound. Easy to pair and help to hear the TV better and add an element of theater feeling. For people complaining, these clearly aren't audiophile quality but for the price I'm more than pleased with them. Have a pretty great sound system now in our Rec room for a little over $200 all in. That's hard to beat

This is a really great product! I bought it as an expansion to the soundbar I purchased and I am really glad I did. The only thing you need to be aware of is when you try to pair it with the soundbar, the directions in the manual are incorrect. In order for it to pair and get it to the point where it will pair is you have to hold down the MUTE button on your television remote control. It took me a while to figure this out, even with the help of customer service, and ultimately discovered this issue on a message board. Once I did that, it paired without any problems and has been amazing ever since.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great Product with Solid Sound from Small Satellite Speaker
reviews.reviewText: I was pleasantly surprised by the sound quality of these speakers...It's outstanding. The system works very well with Samsung Soundbar. The setup is straight forward...just remember to use the remote control of the Samsung Soundbar (use the Control button---press on the top portion of the control button for 3 to 4 seconds for parring).

reviews.reviewDate: The manufacturer commented on the review below
reviews.reviewText: I've worked and worked with these speakers to try and get decent sound out of them, and for the life of me I can't. I followed the suggestions of other reviewers on here by turning up the volume only to the back speakers to +6, and they're still just whisper quiet. I know they're on because I can hold the speaker up to my ear and hear a faint bit of sound. Unfortunately these just don't work.

reviews.reviewDate: The manufacturer commented on the review below
reviews.reviewText: I was expecting these to be much larger than they were. The Receiver box is about the size of a router maybe a tad bigger & the speakers are maybe EXTREMELY small. People mention they have a ton of issues getting these sync'd up with their soundbar? It's VERY easy, just popped on Youtube, found a vid & bam it was done within 2 minutes...very easy but the lack of instructions can be confusing. The speakers themselves are NOT loud at all.

Love these! They paired effortlessly with my Costco bought Samsung sound bar. You can adjust the volume on them (a quick google search will show you how) and there's been numerous times I've then had to pause whatever show I was watching to make sure the police sirens or bird noises were not coming from inside my home haha.

Before purchasing, leave in your cart for a few weeks and see how the price fluctuates. I noticed that it went up and down in price by as much as $35

reviews.reviewTitle: These don’t work with standard speaker stands!
reviews.reviewText: These are a great addition to the sound bar. Like other reviewers I’d turned them up to +6. The only downside I have to these are the holes in the back used for mounting are much too small for standard speaker stands. I went through the top purchased speaker stands on amazon and I had to return them. Eventually I just settled for some I could stick on the tops. Not as secure as screwing them into the speaker but they’re just behind the couch so they should be fine.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good for the money. But wish I bought higher end.
reviews.reviewDate: The manufacturer commented on the review below
reviews.reviewText: These are very quite compared to the other speakers in front. You basically dont know they are there on some movies, games. The fact you have to run a wire to them from another unit that wireless connects to your existing sound bar is annoying and makes it look bad. I dont see why these speakers could not be wireless, The subwoofer is wireless and the soundbar has a wireless connection to the tv. So this just makes for a ugly install when you will see the wires going to them.

At the time I purchased these speakers, only one reviewer mentioned how small these speakers are. They're approximately the size of an average hand from wrist to fingertips. The photos make them look much larger. In any case, they sound great. I'd encourage getting a set, especially if they're under $85. Great value at this price. Note that they are not truly wireless. The main unit, the larger rectangle in the photos, is Bluetooth connected to the soundbar, but the little satellite speakers are hardwired to the main unit. If placed right it has something of a wireless effect, just wanted you to know what you're getting.

reviews.reviewDate: The manufacturer commented on the review below
reviews.reviewText: I gave these two stars because they work; but not well. Even when the rear speaker volume is set to +6, i could barely hear them. I tried using other speakers with the supplied amplifier and it was unsuccessful. There is a frequency restricter in the unit that only uses the tweeters and a little of the woofer frequency. I hear verry little difference when using these. If you are looking to set up surround sound, and have recently purchased the sound bar, return it. Get a viseo system or buy a receiver and set the whole thing up yourself; don’t waste your money on this. I returned mine.

reviews.reviewTitle: Compatible with my Samsung Sound Bar.
reviews.reviewText:
I made sure that this worked with my model Samsung sound bar before I ordered. Once the Sound Bar was working properly I hooked up the surround system as described in the manual and voila, every thing worked great. For the price, it makes a nice improvement .

Just verify that it is compatible with your model Sound Bar before getting frustrated with set up.

Solid little surround speakers. Easy to set up. Just follow the directions in the manual. They sound great in my bedroom with my sound bar and subwoofer. I plan to mount them on the walls, above my bed. Can’t beat the $65 price either.
Don’t expect these to blow you out of the water in a large living room but if they’re placed relatively close to the listeners position, like they are in my bedroom, you’ll be satisfied. My only complaint is that they sound a little hollow when playing music but I know that is because it’s a small speaker in a plastic cabinet. I kind of expected that. I wasn’t searching for high quality audio, just something to fill out the rest of the system.

reviews.reviewDate: The manufacturer commented on the review below
reviews.reviewText: Couldn’t not get this to pair, following instructions to the letter! Had hoped after reading other reviews it was a fluke every now and then. Nope, can’t get mine to work either

Bought these to go with my Samsung MU8500 TV and MS650 soundbar..If you want bass, you'll need the subwoofer...Otherwise, these are not too overpowering and add a nice touch to your sound system over the standard TV speakers..Easy to install and paired almost immediately with the soundbar and subwoofer..

Easy to set up. Works fine with my Samsung 3.1 m550 sound bar. Don't expect lots of volume. It just adds a bit more than with just the Soundbar and subwoofer. Purchase a pair of adjustable-height stands that you can run the wires through and you'll be set.

Purchased this add on to go with my M450 sound bar. Plug & Play installation and provides the added depth to music and movies. Doesn't blow you out of the room but perfect for my listening pleasure. Can't go wrong for the price. Follow instructions carefully and adjustments will be a brease. Just takes some getting used to like any new product. I would buy again and recommend to others.

Has the HMDI hook up that is the best if your TV has the ARC input. Really great sound and you should pair it with the
Samsung HW-M550 3.1 Channel 340 Watt Wireless rear speakers. Once things are all plugged in the entire system works together with it all coming online when the TV remote goes on/off. Brings movies to life with excellent surround sound!

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy install in Samsung system - at this price it's a no brainer!
reviews.reviewText: This was designed to work with a Samsung soundbar and was a quick install but when I first tested it I got no sound. I tried a few different programs on my cable box and nothing. Then it dawned on me to try a different program that I was certain had 5.1 surround and sure enough it was plenty loud and sounds great. There is plenty of volume and the sound is very good using Dolby settings. If you have a problem after setting it up, be sure that you are watching a source that has 5.1 surround and the speakers aren't connected to the wire insulation, instead of the wire. Also the speakers are very small and stylish so we just set them on some end tables and we're good to go!

reviews.reviewTitle: Good speaker system, if you get past the paper-thin Samsung support.
reviews.reviewText: InitiallyThe speakers work just OK with my soundbar. I've tried setting it up twice, but the sound coming out is softer than the soundbar. I then took advice from John R. Hanson's review and now it works properly. He was right, Samsung should've provided better instructions and support for this.

reviews.reviewDate: The manufacturer commented on the review below
reviews.reviewText: These are a nice addition to the base unit. They do seem a little quiet, so don't expect a ton of crazy sound; but they do add to the overall sound. They were easy to setup and pair with the main soundbar. Keep in mind these are still wired from the speaker to the transmitter. The only wireless portion is the transmitter to the soundbar.

reviews.reviewTitle: Pairing is simple once you find the “mute” button
reviews.reviewText: I have the Samsung HW M550. I finally decided to get the rear speakers and O think they work very well. Pairing the units was initially difficult, as the instructions say to press the “mute” button on the soundbar remote down for several seconds. The remote does not have a stand-alone mute button. I discovered that pressing the volume button straight down serves as the mute function. Once I figured that out, pairing was simple. For the money, I don’t think you can get a better surround sound system. Very happy with my purchase.

reviews.reviewDate: The manufacturer commented on the review below
reviews.reviewText: These speakers are just sad. While I was able to figure out they were not really wireless (only the control box and amplifier connects wirelessly), I have been unable to get them to produce enough sound to hear. Now I'll have to find the time to interact with Samsung to figure out what's wrong. I'm not hopeful based on the other reviews.

Very impressive sound for the price. Already purchased a Samsung Harmon Kardon HW-Q6CR sound bar. I had read a review about the speaker connections and I have to agree: Be sure you do not push the wires too far into the rear of the speakers. Other than that one small issue, I am very please with the sound, DEFINITELY SURROUND.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works a lot better than I expected
reviews.reviewText: After reading some reviews that were very negative on Amazon, I decided to look for reviews somewhere else. Many were positive and a few negatives. I took a chance and purchased the setup. The speakers work real well, but the rear volume is a bit on the low side. All in all I am enjoying my purchase, it truly pops when watching movies.

reviews.reviewTitle: Second Purchase - It WILL NOT LINK.
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this item twice, having just purchased a new Samsung 8 series UHD TV and a compatible Samsung HW-M450 Soundbar. This product is compatible with both devices, and the soundbar and this device have a completely common and exact means of connection with Bluetooth link. The first product would not link, even after many attempts, seeking answers on the Samsung web site, and speaking with a Samsung tech who was excellent. I purchased it a second time, only to feel dumb when it would not link, and being determined to make it work. Again, the Samsung tech worked very hard, called in help, and it WOULD NOT LINK. Check other reviews and the web for this device and you'll see that this is not an isolated fault. Amazon should give Samsung some notice to clean up their act on this product.

reviews.reviewTitle: A good upgrade to a samsung soundbar
reviews.reviewText:
In terms of setting things up, it was really simple. The speaker's controller quickly connected to the soundbar and I was off and running. The one thing was the speaker cable for each speaker was a little short. Sure I could have spliced more cable in, so it's not that much of an issue in reality, but if you're planning on placing the controller box on one side of the room, you might have trouble reaching the opposing wall with the included wire. Sound quality is pretty great with the exception that you have to fiddle with the volume of the satellites via the soundbar remote. By default, they're a little quiet.

Overall it was a worth it upgrade to my television watching experience.

Yeah there are some cables, but all I care about is sound quality. And I cannot tell a difference between the soundbar and rear speakers. Also gaming is sweet, I can actually hear things wizz past my head or clanks of enemy's throughing/shooting along with floor creaking with accuracy. I imagine many low scores are due to connectivity, or discovering a...oh god, Cable! Gasp. However works excellently for me. So it won't initially sync with the directions. When you get to hitting the reset button, just press it once and dont hold. Then when changing the sound volume. Use settings button keep pressing. Once you get to rear level, use the directional pad up or down.

I bought these to work with a samsung sound bar. They work really well, but I wish you could turn them down more and or adjust the volume per side. All in all I am happy with these and running the thin wires was cake. I was able to mount these in a sanus stand. It took a little effort but it works.

They are what you think they are, inexpensive speakers the work pretty well...just don't expect too much. I will say the Amazon worked with me as I purchased the wrong pair for my sub, but they accepted a return and even picked up the cost.
Works great!! Took a few times to sync. Be patient if you can't get it to sync. Keep trying. It will eventually work.

reviews.reviewTitle: For the price point excellent sound, But, ...
reviews.reviewText: You must purchase the OPTIONAL ($99) rear speakers unit (wireless with the soundbar, wired 2 rear speakers to remodel module). Settings: Surround (with optional rear speakers) , Standard, Movies, Voice, Sports, "Clear (?)". Bass and Treble Adjustable. Use and Optical cable rather that HDMI for audio for better sound.

reviews.reviewTitle: Terrible, totally useless. Do not purchase
reviews.reviewDate: The manufacturer commented on the review below
reviews.reviewText: Terrible, terrible, terrible on all levels. I have a bluetooth soundbar and this product is absolutely useless. It will not pair with my Samsung soundbar at all. Very cheap and low quality. I'm shocked that Samsung would make such a poor quality product. Sending it back for a full refund. Do not buy this useless product

If you know how to follow instructions and want a great surround system to go with your sound bar then this is a great addition. I have it set up and it really makes you feel like your in a theater. I have the curved samsung 75 tv, the samsung sound bar with subwoofer and now this. Amazing all together.

The manual is horrible as there are no instructions on how to adjust the volume.

To adjust the volume of these speakers on a Samsung N550 push the settings (gear looking button) until the rear speakers on lights then push the settings button again and rear speaker level will show and then a number, then push up in the big round button to your desired level. That's it.
Just a note, I have my n550 connected to a qled via bluetooth.

I will say I am disappointed in the sound quality... great TV's, terrible sound bars....The rear speakers are flat, or I'm just spoiled by Bose.... I also have a sound bar, also Samsung, which falls way flat compared to my Bose system....There is virtually no Sub woofer despite there being a sub..... epic fail Sam sung. I returned a set that was incompatible with my sound bar... surprise. the company was not a Prime purchase, so shipping back cost me 1/3 the price of the speakers... lesson learned.They did reach out and offer a $15 credit to another purchase which I declined... nice on their part to offer. 4 stars for the customer service, NOT the quality of the Samsung product.

Completes the surround system.
Perfect with Samsung sound bar Q80R Instantly paired, a breeze to set up
No problems with setup. Sound is very low.

I had purchased the Samsung soundbar prior to getting the rear speakers the soundbar work great but I really wanted that surround sound. I'm very pleased with this purchase. I only had to reference the user's guide once to figure out how to pair the control box to the soundbar.

Speakers are small but quality of sound is great. Didn’t work at first, but I had read the other reviews and one plug was pushed in too far. Pulled it out a bit and it worked great. Couldn’t be happier. Connected right away with my sound bar and woofer.

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice compliment for select Samsung soundbars to enhance the sound
reviews.reviewText:
Not much to say other than they work very well as a rear speaker solution for the Samsung HW-M4500 curved soundbar. I've set up these with my soundbar in the master bedroom (yes, I wanted surround sound in the bedroom), and they add that extra dimension to the movies, shows, and music I watch in that room. The main reason I got these (and the soundbar) was because I play long-running sleep meditation music videos on YouTube on my smart TV at night so I wanted to be able to better fill the room with sound at lower volumes, and they work excellent in that capacity. I'm actually quite pleasantly surprised how many music videos on YouTube (meditation or otherwise) are mixed with surround sound capabilities, and some do it very well.

Pros:
- Easy setup, only 2 wires from the wireless receiver to the speakers, and color coded
- Wireless sync worked on the first try and has been solid since setup
- Small speakers can be placed almost anywhere taking up very little space

Cons:
- Low power: Had to crank up the rear speaker volume on the soundbar settings to max to balance the soundbar and rear speaker level, and the rear speakers are much closer to me, half the distance to my ears than the soundbar.

Sound quality was better than expected for the size of the speakers. This set up is wireless from your sound bar to the Wi-Fi receiver that is wired to each speaker. Surround sound performance is great! I would recommend this addition to your Samsung sound bar system.

Added this to my Hw-n550, which isn't listed on here but it does work fine. Plugged it in, hit 2 buttons and it was linked and working. Great addition to my entertainment system. Samsung always delivers good products. It's all my wife and I buy.

Wow. What a huge difference adding the rear speakers for true surround sound! Love it!
Easy to connect.

Perfect sound once you get the hang of the adjustments which are not described in the manual. I'll advise you to refer to the questions and answers section of the product, if you want to fully enjoy these pretty smart loudspeakers. You can't adjust left and right speaker volumes separately. Manual is insufficient.

reviews.reviewTitle: They work but I can’t say it makes a difference.
reviews.reviewDate: The manufacturer commented on the review below
reviews.reviewText:
They definitely work, I’m going to experiment with positioning but I really can’t tell they are working unless I get right on them. Maybe that is the point though :).

Other than that pairing with my sound bar was incredibly simple and the receiver has pretty good range.

This was pretty much plug and play. I now have surround sound for my TV. We recently upgraded to a bigger, 4K TV and wanted upgraded sound. Bought just the sound bar and used it for a while but decided the surround was the way to go, and it was. Sound great.

reviews.reviewTitle: adds rear speakers to the sound bar
reviews.reviewText: No noticeable lag on audio, I was able to wall mount the speakers with command strips. I had to put the subwoofer in search mode while this was in search mode as well to get the soundbar to detect and connect these speakers.

The sound quality definitely takes some "getting used to". Works okay when watching TV but much better with music playing through the sound bar and new speakers.

When putting the wires into the rear of the speakers, make sure it's only the part of the wire that has been stripped.

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice add on to my soundbar
reviews.reviewDate: The manufacturer commented on the review below
reviews.reviewText: Only wish they got a little louder. I think my hearing may be starting to go. lol
You can tell the difference when you install this surround sound system to your current sound bar. You can really tell when you are watching a movie or playing a video game, GOOD PRODUCT!

reviews.reviewDate: The manufacturer commented on the review below
reviews.reviewText: Finally, I successfully paired the rear speaker set with my Samsung soundbar N450 and got it to work. However, it was disappointed that the speaker sound was too low that you could barely hear it even the volume was set to max +6.

reviews.reviewTitle: Adjust the sound level and enjoy
reviews.reviewText: Purchased this SWA-8500S rear speaker kit to pair with my HW-N650 Sound Bar for a full surround sound experience. It was easy to setup and I was very impressed with the sound quality. I would recommend others who are looking to enhance their sound quality for an affordable price to give it a try. From the factory, the sound level is set at zero for the two speakers. You will simply have to adjust the volume to 4+ depending on where in the room you decide to mount the speakers.

It works! Thanks to all the 5,4,3stars comments, I read them all before buying it and install it, and refer back to these very informative and helpful tips, I have it running perfectly. BTW, a housewife w no clue of how sounds systems supposed to work.

reviews.reviewTitle: I can not recommend these speakers
reviews.reviewDate: The manufacturer commented on the review below
reviews.reviewText:
Where to begin :(..

Bottom Line: I can not recommend these speakers, the subwoofer or the soundbar they go with.

I am unsure if I have a faulty product, and I will coordinate with Samsung and update the result of this and adjust my stars as needed but here is why it is 2 stars. Anyone who has purchased a home theatre system has learned to hear sound all around them at all times, this system is different. It only activated the rear speakers when there is an actual sound effect that the system recognizes should activate them. Depending on what your watching you will hardly hear any sound from these speakers. It is cool when they work but that leads to the other issues:

1. Constantly loses connection to the soundbar, when sitting down to play xbox1 or watch a movie I am getting up no less than an average of five times to re connect everything. And if it wasnt such a pain I wouldnt even mind, however I have to pause whatever im doing. Turn the soundbar off, access the wireless receiver (no problem for me it is next to my couch in the open, *keep this in mind if you wanted to hide this under or behind your couch*) and use needle nose tweezers to activate the button to reconnect the sound bar (hold down for 10 seconds). Than goto the subwoofer flip that upside down (not light, and gently) do it to that, then hold mute button on the soundbar controller (volume button pressed down) for another 10 seconds. Turn on the Soundbar and hope they both connect again, otherwise I have to restart that all over again.. I just did this 3x in the last 20 minutes as an example while playing xbox1 shadow of war, very upset which led me to here.

2. The speakers didnt even work out of the box, I had the rear speakers +6 and never heard a peep, however I updated the firmware just released in November and it seems to fixed the issue. Now the only issue is they hardly ever activate and disconnect so often that I never know when they are connected until I hear a cool sound effect, or finally realize I haven't heard anything in a long time.

reviews.reviewText:
absolute no sound or so I thought . Ill start by stating i did sync it properly and ill tell you how .
1if you have the soundbar and woofer 1rst use the remote and turn it OFF then for 5 sec. press mute or till you see the soundbar light up with words
2nd turn soundbar back on press the button on back of your new wireless box and it should flash blue for another 5 seconds then stay solid walla synced
now the problems junky old speaker wire , now pluging it into the bluetooth unit is no problem grey on 1 side blue on the other and they ony go in 1 way .
On to the actual rear speakers finally we connected them and heard nothing so messed with the wires to make sure only metal was touching not any wire cover . So we slightly removed all 4 wires and with all volumes on 1 and the a/c off we heard static like a radio wow so now on to setting them up in the soundbar yea =) i thought Hold the sprocket on soundbar remote for about 6 seconds or until you can change treble bass etc. Scroll thru until you get to rear speakers make sure they are turned ON then scroll one more to rear speaker adjustment we went to the max +6 and turned the soundbar up to 20 (it goes to 100 the HW-M550 and is far superior to the hw-n550 2018 system or even the 650 which is 700$ ) anyway back to the story now the set up is complete the soundbar says rear speakers on and at +6 the a/c kicked on and i heard nothing untill a song came on on a movie we watched for 20 minutes trying to get these to play to where we could hear them . Then with the speakers heald to our ears 1 to mine and the other to my husbands we heard some background music "surround sound "lol i had to turn the soundbar down to 5 to hear anything . I bought these for my husband because both of us wanted to heat better clarity and sound when the air or dishwasher was going without turning up the soundbar to much because after 25 the sub does have real punch and again it goes to 100 volume . so after about 30 min . we said this is a joke it was the equivalent to having the tv on volume 1 no sound system . GARBAGE NEVER AGAIN Even read the same for LG cut out no sound etc .
Only go bose for rear speakers (which the box clearly stated but yet no words or sound ever came out only light whispers of music with 5 to 10 min. intervals of any sound .

I was also able to put the wireless receiver under my couch and run the rear speaker wires from the receiver to the speakers under my couch against the wall so they are completely undetectable. reviews.reviewTitle: Honest Review - A Worthy Addition to a Compact Sound System
reviews.reviewText:
Nice set of small rear surrounds. I received them as a Christmas gift to pair with my Samsung HW-MS650 soundbar.

After setting everything up and updating firmware (a must), I have had no problems. Not sure if other reviews complaining about signal drops and low volume updated their firmware. I have had no issues with the volume of the speakers; they fit nicely into the mix. After updated firmware and hooking up speakers, the soundbar volume seemed higher on lower settings as well. The connection has not dropped once since setting everything up.

The speakers do their job and add that extra rear dimension when paired with your soundbar. I watched The Force Awakens after setup and the new sound experience was excellent; blaster shots and ships tracked L to R and vise versa behind me, thematic music filled 360 degrees of the room These definitely improve the cinematic experience. That being said, these are not high end speakers so don't expect that; they cost $120 bucks. Do you know how much good speakers cost?

I would have deducted one-half star if I could due to design. As most reviewers note, these are not 100% wireless. You still have to hook the speakers into a small amp that receives a wireless signal from the soundbar. This was likely a cost/design decision by Samsung. Adding a power amp and Bluetooth into each separate speaker would have increased speaker size, weight and consumer cost. The power amp itself is small (about the size of a thick hardcover book) and blends into my book case fine. It could also fit under my couch if desired. The speakers are small and attractive. I like that the finish and grills match the soundbar perfectly.

Overall I am satisfied with sound quality/product for the price point. Movies and Music sound even better on my compact living room sound system. If you are going to purchase these, just be aware you will still have speaker cable on your rear wall and the power amp requires an outlet. Additionally, make sure to update your firmware!

Are there better sounding speakers for the price? Yes, but these allow me to have a full sound stage with NO floor standing speakers and subtle rear speakers. If you are an audiophile and/or have room for a large system these are likely not for your. If you want a decent sounding system with a small, clean footprint give these and the Samsung HW-MS650 Soundbar a try.

reviews.reviewTitle: Be careful what sound bar you pair these with or you won't get REAL surround sound!
reviews.reviewText: These actually aren't bad speakers for what they cost and being wireless. The connection is solid and I had no issues. But make sure your soundbar supports more than two audio channel decoding. My soundbar, the samsung M450 doesn't. It only supports 2 channel DTS and DD. , You will just hear a simulation of surround sound which does an OK job but its nothing compared to a real dedicated 5.1 channel setup with individual channels. Check the specifications on the soundbar you want to purchase to make sure. I know the Samsung M550 DOES support dolby digital 5.1 channel decoding, so I think with that soundbar you will get a true surround experience rather than a simulated one. Not Samsung's fault, just have to be careful with the specs of what you're buying. It is not an HDMI or Optical issue either, its simply a limitation of certain soundbars such as the M450. If you want real surround, make sure the soundbar supports it because I don't believe adding these speakers will magically increase the audio decoding ability of the soundbar.

reviews.reviewTitle: Long Review, but worth the read if on the fence.
reviews.reviewText:
Okay so for starters yes these are rear speakers so you place them behind you (I mention this because in the Samsung video it shows them being installed in front of you but if you do a bit of research behind you is the correct place). Second they are complementary speakers they aren’t meant to make whatever you’re listening to louder it’s more for it to give you that surround sound affect (for example a helicopter flying by). Third the module that links to the sound bar is wireless you can place it in the back of the room plug to an outlet and it’ll link wirelessly to the sound bar BUT the speakers themselves are not wireless, each speaker runs 1 wire (speaker wire, yes it’s provided) back to the wireless module. Install is pretty easy you just set the sound bar in ID SET mode and it’ll link right away (heads up the instructions say go “volume down” in order to place your sound bar in ID SET mode but you literally push the volume down button down as in toward the remote many just like myself don’t realize that’s the mute and that’s how you go into ID SET mode, if you go volume down it will put you in SHOP1 mode). Lastly once they are all plugged in I would do a little research on sound direction cause if you just place them but don’t have them pointing towards where you are going to be sitting you won’t really be able to experience these speakers. I bought some $8 speaker wall mounts here from Amazon and I really noticed the difference after that.

Now for the product itself I have it paired with the MW360 sound bar which is the base model and the base model sub woofer. When these three components are tied together they are great and sound really good I mainly use it for movies and it truly gives you that surround sound affect.
