reviews.reviewTitle: Finicky, but you dont got any other options
reviews.reviewDate: The manufacturer commented on the review below
reviews.reviewText:
These speakers get the job done if you want a 5.1 setup to go along with your Samsung soundbar. They're not *exceptional* in sound quality, but then again i wouldn't know what good satellites are supposed to sound like.

They were quiet out of the box, but with the helpful reviews here, putting it to +4/3 is a good bet

There is a bit of lag going to the speakers when playing things like dolby atmos demos, but its only noticeable in said demos. in regular 5.1 content, you dont even notice it.
Another thing to note is that every 15-20 minutes or so, the rear/subwoofer will cut out for like 3 seconds and then keep playing like its nothing. I'm assuming this is because the soundbar is handling too many wireless inputs at one time and resets or something just because.

one flaw that may steer people away is that if you hide the reciver box behind something like a couch or a wall, expect it to cut out a lot. Line of sight is pretty much required for this thing to function without hearing it cut out / studder every 15 seconds.

Bottom line: read other reviews for instructions on how to set the volume if you do buy it. Wait for a sale or buy from ebay or something because even at less than $100, they arent that worth it, but if you want a 5.1 setup with your Samsung soundbar, i dont think 3rd party satellite speakers even exist, so they do the job well enough.

These are rear specific speakers for certain sound bars. I was at first dissapointed in the small size when opened the box; but gained appreciation for the small size and big sound once hooked up. My MonoPrice banana clips (for speaker wire) were too big to use, and the speaker wire that cane with them is thin & has clips on the end that go into the power box (plugged into wall/not wireless) so these are a great choice (got refurbs) for the money but having once had a real 5.1 Surround / Stereo receiver setup) they are more of a good Tv sound bar-Easy setup for families. Not quite the full movie theater room experience - but pretty amazing sound and easy setup since they connect to soundbar with a wireless dongle (provided). I’d buy again or a second set given the chance.

reviews.reviewTitle: it seems to be the ONLY place you can get good user info when you cant figure out how to ...
reviews.reviewDate: The manufacturer commented on the review below
reviews.reviewText: Read the REVIEWS, it seems to be the ONLY place you can get good user info when you cant figure out how to make these speakers work! I called GeekSquad and spoke with no one after waiting 2x for 15-20 mins. I downloaded the manuals for the Samsung soundbar (HW450) and for these 8500 speakers because speakers came with NO instructions. Even the user manual gives very little detailed info! The reviewers who had the same problems were the BIG help and I always read reviews b/4 making a tech purchase. Volume was my issue and not totally resolved. The whole system is VERY low volume. As to the sound quality, still "muddy"

I wanted to love these! The family got a new TV, a soundbar, and these to go with it. Everything was going great so I decided to get these rear speakers going. I see from the wireless module that it says it's connected, but I don't hear sound. I look it up and see many people saying sound it too low so I pick up the speaker and hold it to my ear. Sure enough there is sound, but it's very quiet. I can control it with the remote but by the time the rear speakers are loud enough, the soundbar is blasting. No they can't be controlled independently. With the advise from many reviews and forums I adjusted the levels to +6 and yes it helped but it was still too quiet.
Perhaps if I had paid $40 for these I'd be okay, but I paid $100.

They were returned, along with the soundbar because these are the only reason we bought the one that we did. I am now looking into other set ups. I expected better from Samsung.

These speakers are *not* adjustable in fade or balance as Samsung may have you believe. I spent half an hour on chat with a Samsung representative according to the Samsung Ambassador who replied above and they were unable to locate any fade or balance settings. Not worth it for the money, pick a different brand that actually implements this incredibly simple option

reviews.reviewTitle: These are actually great speakers! Read the reviews!
reviews.reviewText: Took me less than 2 minutes to set this up. Regarding issues with low sound, i have the opposite problem! i have them at -4 and they are still very loud. I have the N550 Soundbar and with these it just makes the movie extremely freaking awesome to hear! You need these! And someone said it earlier,but the correct way is to go to settings,rear speakers,rear speakers level, wait for the number zero to appear then you can raise or lower the audio of the rear speakers. THEY ARE LOUD!

Turn the rear speakers on via soundbar menu and volume to highest level 6. Make sure to plug in soundbar via hdmi not optical cable to enable bitstream audio (aka more than 2.1 audio now that you have 4+ speakers). Also don't select 5.1 in whatever audio source you are using because it will lower the volume or you may be missing channels. With that said, these speakers will automatically separate sounds and the volume is great.

The issues most of the negative reviews have with this besides it not being truly wireless (both speakers connect to wireless box by rather short audio cables) is that it isn’t loud enough.

reviews.reviewTitle: Yes they sound great, nice addition
reviews.reviewText: So I bought the Samsung HW m550 Soundbar with wireless subwoofer sounds great easy to set up I had no issues with the amount of Base the subwoofer puts out I even have mine turned up only to level 3 sounds great I think a lot of people are having issues because of their placement anyway I caught a great deal on the rear speakers so I thought I'd give it a shot as far as setup my setup didn't work you're supposed to hold the volume button down for five or six seconds and then the ID pops up on the the Soundbar that did not work for me after reading some forums you have to make sure shop 1 is turned off and you do that by holding the volume button down towards - minus meaning lower volume for a few seconds shop will pop up and display as off once I did that I held the volume button straight down the ID popped up then you turn the sound bar on and they sync no problem. So I turned on a 5.1 surround movie I chose Captain America winter warrior because it's got a lot of action immediately I noticed the difference in the sound placement I have a open abnormal shaped room so sound escapes easily but it was a huge difference they were a little low in volume but it's still sounded great helicopters going from left to right people talking in the back it was pretty cool and I have mine just set up on a little stand on one side and on the other side actually sitting only a foot from the ground because I haven't got my mini stands yet, so not the most optimal setup but it works for now I thought I would attempt to turn the volume up on the rear speakers and if you go through settings on your Soundbar you'll get to rear speaker level you could go up to 6 or down 6 I put it at 4 and it's even louder all in all for the price I got from them it's great plus the wires on the speaker side are regular wires so you can use any speakers that you have hope this helps some people have a great holiday
